Articles.Content: I want to run ksp v.0.23 on my pc but the problem was I only have 2 GB ram.... But I already convert some of my hard drive space into ram so I just want to ask that can I still run the ksp on my pc....
When you say you converted hard drive space into ram, what do you mean exactly?

Well, having a very large pagefile fits the description, for example.

@Nemo246: grab the free demo version on steam and try it out!

Ram is crazy cheap nowadays, especially old-style ram. Just order a cheap 2gb stick from Ebay or Amazon...that way you have the maximum amount of ram KSP can handle.

I don't think a large page file would really help as much as buying extra ram. Installation is easy, it only fits into the ram slot

I have a 1.86 GHz Core 2 Duo processor & 2GB of RAM. I need to turn the graphics settings way down, but KSP is completely playable on my machine. Used to get a lot of crashing issues, but they've really been working on optimisation recently and it shows.

The system requirements are just the minimum system specs that they can (almost) guarantee will run the game. The "minimum" is rarely a hard requirement but it helps to have better than what they say. I, for example, have a low-level, $60 Intel Pentium G2020 and I can not only play KSP but also stream it at a decent quality level.

I agree with Streetwind though, check out the free demo and see how it performs. 0.23 is a bit more optimized than 0.18.3 but it should be a fair indicator of the settings you can run at a decent framerate.
